statement.tex: %text A die is thrown again and again until three sixes are obtained. Find the probability of obtaining the third six in the sixth throw of the dice. %

step.context: %text Which of the following is an example of a favourable outcome? %
step.reason: %text Any favourable outcome will have the following two characteristics $\qquad (i)$ Three sixes total. $\qquad (ii)$ A six on the last (sixth) throw. $\qquad$ Which means, two sixes in throws 1-5. %

step.context: %text Given what a favourable outcome looks like, what will be the required probability? %
